website_summaries.verdict: Perhaps not the first choice for daily hive work, but it is ideal for once-a-week inspections or as a temporary protective suit for visitors.
pros: Affordable price point for a back-up or temporary suit
Veil mesh does not obscure vision
cons: Gloves and pants not included in set
Veil mesh not well supported, can contact skin

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Coming in and out of garage hadn't noticed hornets taking up residence in 14' deep porch. No place to run so bought this suit. Got 10 nests today and nothing got me but they sure tried. I wore jeans, sweatshirt, and rubber boots with it just in case. It was 100 degrees and I did sweat. Sprayed them, knocked down nests, and swept them up with no problems. I'm 5'9", 135 lbs. and I'm wearing a men's large. Again, these were hornets, not bees, and it worked fine. I thought the price was great.
customer_reviews.author: Spirited 1

customer_reviews.title: Good fit even for tall person
customer_reviews.text: I really don't like getting stung so I always wear a suit and gloves. Our hive is generally passive but dropping a frame the other day made them rather unhappy. I'm tall (6' 5") but the fit was ok. The netting on the hat goes all the way around... Good for air flow but the fit caused the netting to lay against the back of my neck. Was just waiting for a bee to land back there and decide that was a good target. Solved that issue by laying a towel across the back of my neck inside the suit. So far, good value for the price. Will very likely purchase another.
customer_reviews.author: agm

customer_reviews.title: The quality of this for the price is excellent. I just used it this weekend on a ...
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this for the price is excellent. I just used it this weekend on a very aggressive hive and it worked great - no stings. I am 6'1" and 200 lbs., it was plenty large enough. The material is a heavy canvas, so I would advise wearing a sweat shirt or sweater underneath in situations where bees are in attack mode. The veil had good visibility. I wear a ball cap underneath it and it helps keep it from shifting around - anyway probably not a problem. The pocket on the front is useless as every time one bends over, whatever is in the pocket falls out.
customer_reviews.author: KFR

customer_reviews.title: Good for Alaska bugs, not for bees
customer_reviews.text: The screen mesh does not stay off the body when bending over, so bee stings are possible. The top of the head is protected by thin material and wearing a hat is difficult since the zipper system is inconvenient. Stay away if bees are the least bit aggressive....
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey robert dunlap

customer_reviews.title: Great quality at a tattered rags price!
customer_reviews.text: Whoa! These sell for $50 at my closest chain farm store. I usually prefer to buy my bee stuff from my local farm co-op or beethinking but my hood crapped out on a month when money was tight and here we are. I kind of assumed that for the price this would be disposable, but the quality is actually really good! The hood zips off the top; the mesh is sturdy and easy to see through; the sizing is accurate! I'm super pleased. Five stars for way exceeding my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie LJ

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: Nice. I put it on like a sweater; its lightweight and not too hot. I did not use the zipper and don't see a need to ever use the zipper. The fabric is lightweight but appears strong enough to prevent a sting. My bees seemed to almost ignore me completely when using this bee suit. Previously I had not been using a bee suit, either nothing or glasses and a hoodie, but this was obviously a lot more comfortable and cooler. I've only used it the one time, but so far I'm very pleased. Good bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Sundevil

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, although ventilation could be better
customer_reviews.text: I have used this suit for a season of beekeeping as an amateur backyarder with two hives. The suit is well built and survived the season with ease. Two pockets are included in the front, which allows for a quick placement of hive tools when working with less-than-friendly bees. In the summer months, ventilation can be an issue. I would advise using the suit in the early morning hours anyway, as checking the bees is a little easier in the morning before they go foraging for nectar and pollen. After a season, the suit will be covered in bee frass (poop) and be discolored, but this is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Q.

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good product .
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice suit. Some people complain about things but there is always a way around anything. I didn't find any problems with it. I read some reviews that said that bees still stung them on the neck. In that case, it would probably be a good idea to wear a handkerchief around your neck. I did not have this problem. I do feel, however; it does run small. I ordered a Large and it was kind of difficult getting in and out of it. Otherwise i totally recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: Avitia

customer_reviews.title: The suit is very light and nice in the hot days of summer
customer_reviews.text: The suit is very light and nice in the hot days of summer, having said that, the hat rim is very flimsy, which allows for the mesh to lay on your neck exposing you to being stung, plus the "hat" has no head band and is too shallow to stay on your head when one bends over.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Boroughs

customer_reviews.title: 🐝Be ready 🐝☀️
customer_reviews.text: This is my first year having a greenhouse. Its was only 60 ☀️degrees when 🐝 a bee came into the greenhouse. I gently guided it out. The material is comfortable. Its easy to put on and take off. I am fine around bees in an open area. Closed areas I get nervous. But I need their help🐝 So buying this bee keeper gear was a must. I remember being stung as a child, not a fan ! The price was right ! I bought a larger size (L). It goes past my waistline. I do not plan on leaving my greenhouse due to visitors 🐝🐝 . Going to Stay Calm n 🐝bee happy, 💕it !
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: Ok for nice bees Have been stung thru the back netting
customer_reviews.text: Ok for nice bees Have been stung thru the back netting, which sets directly on the back of my neck. Now I wear a ball-cap backwards to make a gap/space. XL is close to being too small for me, 6' 2" 230
customer_reviews.author: Jay Lark

customer_reviews.title: Got stung
customer_reviews.text: On a day with wind I find it hard to keep the hat on my head right. The wind blew the netting against my cheek and I got stung through the veil. I am now much more aware of where the veil is now and correct it if it touches my skin now. However, I would rather have a hat/veil that worked well without having to divert my attention from what I am trying to do.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Fister

customer_reviews.title: Order larger than you think you need.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in a size large for my husband, who is a beginner beekeeper. He is 5'8" and 170 lbs, and normally wears a size medium in shirts. I ordered this in a large so he'd have extra room because it is worn over the clothes. The order was fulfilled quickly and we received it today. He put it on and it fits, but it JUST fits. It's a little snug in the body and was hard to remove. We are returning it for an xl. Hopefully it will be easier to slip on and off. Other than that, this seems to be a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Momma C

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you layer up. I removed an unwanted Africanized bee colony using this and it worked well. Be careful though! There isn't much rigidity in the neck/collar region, and when a stiff breeze pushed the mesh up against my face, I was stung once on the right cheek. I wore insulated leather gloves and the elastic around the sleeves and waist worked great; no bees got in at all. Also, the zipper at the neck is convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: My wife is a beekeeper and needs my help from time to time. Guess I'm the sous-beekeeper. She got this for me and I've already worn it for more than two hours. No bites and no close calls. I like the bonnet more than the one in her bee suit as I can see much better. I tuck it into my jeans, although you wouldn't need to as the elasticized bottom would keep you safe. Overall, I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Spiker

customer_reviews.title: Budget friendly option for gentle hives!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a beekeeper for several years and my old hood tore. This hood was in my budget and while it’s not the highest quality, it does the job. The hat doesn’t stay on very snug, so you just have to be aware of not letting the netting touch your face. The elastic around the waste and wrists is good and tight. The fabric is lightweight and comfortable. If you have an aggressive hive, this may not work for you. If you have just a few hives and they are relatively gentle, then this budget friendly hood/jacket definitely does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Katie K.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Every summer I get lots of wasp nests on my two story house. I bought this jacket to help protect me from stings while eradicating the wasp nests. I used it last night and while I'm not sure if it prevented any stings, it gave me the confidence to get on a ladder with a new can of wasp spray. I will continue to use the jacket in the future.
customer_reviews.author: jfadal

customer_reviews.title: Value buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought as Halloween costume since I knew it would be higher quality for the same price range (as other “costumes” on amazon). I got the XL version and I am 6’3” tall and 210 lbs ~~ It’s plenty long enough. Arms are also more than enough in length. Solid purchase, even if you aren’t actually working with bees.
customer_reviews.author: KALTM

customer_reviews.title: Good little bee suit
customer_reviews.text: This bee suit was for a four year old and she thought it was just too tight. She does like her clothes loose, but it was challenging to put on. Once it was on, it worked as expected. I really liked the zipper for the hood and how it kept her safe from the bees. It is definitely for smaller children wanting to check bees, but it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Don’t bother unless you have a head the size of a beach ball. Netting lays on shoulders so easy target, nothing can be done to keep hat from sliding all over. Veil hits neck, face, shoulders. I bought a med and the jacket fit great but had to return as the hat/veil was nonfunctional. Tried to communicate with seller, got no response even weeks later. Strongly suggest you keep shopping
customer_reviews.author: katherine smith

customer_reviews.title: not worth the inexpensive price -
customer_reviews.text: The garment is WAYYY too hot and heavy. Doesn't breathe. In the dead of summer, you will bake! The hat doesn't have a wide enough brim so the netting is constantly ON and IN your face. I threw it out and ordered a different one
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, but for the smell
customer_reviews.text: True to size and fits great. The one lost star is for a funny, chemical smell when it first comes out of the bag. I'd let it sit out before putting it on because it made me feel light headed at first. Other than that, it's a great, inexpensive costume to match my dog's bumblebee for Halloween!
customer_reviews.author: Josie T

customer_reviews.title: Slipping a long-sleeved non-stretchy item over your head and clothing isn't easy. I wish I had noticed no front zipper ...
customer_reviews.text: This serves the purpose when working with bees. The only challenge (and reason why I marked four stars) is the difficulty taking on and off. Slipping a long-sleeved non-stretchy item over your head and clothing isn't easy. I wish I had noticed no front zipper or velcro. Our other suits open up for much easier dressing. However, the price of this is superbly low...so if you are good at wiggling in and out of stuff, this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Youngman

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you like getting stung...
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, the veil is not supported well meaning, it sits on your face which means you can get stung. I figured maybe they had improved it since those reviews but not. It is also very thin. But the main thing is the way the veil just "sits" on your skin. the bees will walk right up and sting. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: As a first time beekeeper I looked at MANY bee suits and jackets. I decided this one was the best value for me. The only complaint I have is that a lot of reviews said these ran on the large size. I do not agree. The fit is a little too snug for easy removal. Other than the size issue, I would highly recommend this pull over. Also a full bee suit can be cumbersome and hot. Blue jeans provide more than enough protection from the honeybees.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Thrasher

customer_reviews.title: Light weigt and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My husband usually wears an Extra Large. I got this in Extra Large for him and it fit him perfectly. We used it as a Halloween costume and he was comfortable in it. Now we'll keep it in case he ever really needs it to handle bee or wasp nests in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Bride to be

customer_reviews.title: Not a fashion statement, but works around aggressive bees.
customer_reviews.text: My wife had to have a picture of me in this bee-suit. I was mowing and out of a large boulder on my acreage came a couple thousand angry bees. I ran for cover and ordered this suit 15 minutes later from Amazon. It might look silly but I mowed and not one bee sting. Take all the pictures you want. This suit is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: dawn t hawks

customer_reviews.title: Get a size larger
customer_reviews.text: Great suit but it runs a little small. I like that it's light weight. Helps out a lot when working the hive on a sunny day. I would suggest getting at least one size larger ....two if you plan on working your hives in the north so you'll have room for layers under the suit. Otherwise I highly recommend !
customer_reviews.author: Chuck K.

customer_reviews.title: So glad I have this top/hat combination - it's everything I needed
customer_reviews.text: It took me a long time to choose an outfit to tend to my bees - whole suit... just hat... or top/hat combination. Glad I choose this one because I don't get too hot wearing this in the summer heat and humidity, yet it provides the safety I need to avoid getting stung (our hive can be a bit testy).
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Nej

customer_reviews.title: It was very good coverage.
customer_reviews.text: The reason I bought this was that my bees attacked me last time I tried to work them. So I bought this pull-over suit. Next time I got near the bees I used my smoker. They did not attack me. Should have use the smoker last time. But I felt very safe in the bee suit. It was fairly easy to put on and the zipper veil was very good.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie Parker

customer_reviews.title: 100% hot garbage
customer_reviews.text: I got stung through the suit! More than once! That's literally the ONE thing I bought the suit for. It hurts to spend $100 on a Mann Lake suit, but it should only be a one time purchase if you buy a good one the first time. Might work for checking welfare of the bees, but NOT for performing a cutout.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: He didn’t get stung while wearing it
customer_reviews.text: My dad was a beekeeper when I was young, and this is not as heavy nor durable as his hat/ jacket separates. We bought it to fight/battle ground hornets after getting stung doing yard work. We won. We like the protection this offers and it kept the hornets at bay. It’s all one piece, so a little hard to pull off if you’re all amped up from running from the hive.
customer_reviews.author: Q kat

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This would be a perfect suit if the netting stayed away from the back of my neck and cheeks. I ware a thin scarf to puff it out a little. Otherwise for the price and quality, I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: waltparsil

customer_reviews.title: Seems fine...
customer_reviews.text: It's lightweight, so that's a plus. I need to wear a baseball cap under it because the hat area is too large for my head and it drops down too low, which interferes with my ability to see without tipping, and holding, the hat back. With a baseball cap on it holds the hat up perfectly. Haven't used it with my bees yet, but I'm guessing it will just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: Had to send this back-hat is too narrow at brim and back of head has netting and due to narrow hat brim-allows bees to sting on the back of your neck. I put a towel on the back of my neck, but too much of a hassle. Also not the easiest to pull over the head when taking off and on. Bought another model with fencing type hood that zips up the front-much safer and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: BShep

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: The pull completely broke off the first time it was used.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: This pull over jacket is light weight and works great. I have been using it once a week for the past 2 months and have had no issues with it. Although, there is no ventilation so on hot days it can get fairly steamy. You cant beat this for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Luke matthews

customer_reviews.title: Great price.
customer_reviews.text: It won't last a lifetime but you didn't pay too much for it either! I got this for my 13 year old helper. It works great. I have machine washed it on delicate and it came out great. The zipper doesn't look like it can hold up to any abuse so we don't use it at all. Just pull it on and go. I will buy another as more kids become interested in the bees.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: im pleased
customer_reviews.text: they should put cloth in back netting,i agree with reviewers its a place to get stung.overall elastic is tight,suit is lite and airy,its my first one and im very pleased with it.i bought xxl .im 6ft,200lbs.it felt snug until i had it on.the chest had room once i got it on.
customer_reviews.author: robomont

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The dark netting at the front is a little shiny and reflects the sun light making it a little difficult to see. The hood zipper came apart, but luckily I was able to get back together. Not sure how well that is going to last. However, for the price I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and thin
customer_reviews.text: Good observation suit but not the strength of a real beekeeper suit. You’ll get popped through it. Needs to be thicker.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Clint Coyle

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This fits my 6 year old perfectly. It also fits my almost 8 year old daughter other than in the arms. When she moves the sleeves go half way up her arms. Wish it came in multiple sizes. The arms is where you need the most protection, so I'll look for very long gloves for her.
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle Jones

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous, Cheap and cheap not functional
customer_reviews.text: Worthless garbage. Cheaply made and unsafe. The biggest problem is that the mesh screen always ends up touching your skin and if you are not careful you will be stung in the neck or face like I was, more than once. I now wear a steel mesh face protector under the mesh which protects my face and a thick winter coat with the hood on. Save your money and buy something better. It’s also coming apart at the hat and zipper seams.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Good Vail, "iffy" jacket protection.
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly sure the jacket is useful at all for protection against stings. It is very thin and I will have my daughter wear a thick sweat shirt under it while at the hive. The Vail seems to provide adequate protection.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this suit is superb. I have used it for one summer of bee keeping and have had zero issue. NO STINGS! Couple of points. 1. I wish the waist pocket was a bit larger. When bending over my hive tools sometimes fall out. 2. I wear a ball cap turned around backwards inside the suit to keep it from resting on my neck. I’m 5’11” 178lbs and the XL fits good with some baggyness.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Jarzyna

customer_reviews.title: Great fit. Easy to take on and off.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit for my husband. Was torn between the full body suit(costume)or this. I'm happy I went with this. Reas reviews on size for the other, seemed it would've been too tight for a 6'0 230lb man. This made his Halloween part night comfortable and easy to wear or take off as needed, especially during transport.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Jacket works well for warm weather work
customer_reviews.text: I needed a jacket for warmer weather bee work and not a full suit. This works well. Easy on/off. When new a few loose threads would get caught in the zipper. Once they were trimmed the zipper worked fine. The XL fit me just fine. I’m 6’/200 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Dpilot

customer_reviews.title: Not for aggressive bees
customer_reviews.text: This is a good suit for the money (it's cheap) but it is not for aggressive hives. If your bees are calm and you can always inspect between 1-3 pm, you should be fine, but if you have to inspect later or pull apart the hive more than just a casual inspection, you'll probably get stung. Aggressive bees will sneak under the elastic waist band or sting through the netting on the hood (especially on the back of the neck).
customer_reviews.author: srhino34

customer_reviews.title: Fits great
customer_reviews.text: Great suit. I ordered a size larger than I needed have extra room. I love fit, the arms are long a fit right over a pair of standard gloves if you are not using gauntlets. The length is long enough to come down well past my belt line to keep me covered when bending over. There's also a zipper along the bottom of the hood that allows you to open it up for a quick drink.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: This white one is much better protection than the camo
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this suit along with another of the same style, but different color: camo, from the same maker. This white one is much better protection than the camo. This white suit is a bit thicker overall, and the holes in the veil are very small. While it may not save you from every sting, the people who have worn have had good luck of not getting stung through it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good materials, good fit.
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot. Sizing is just right, maybe just a bit on the small side. I usually wear XL, ordered XL and it fits well if just a bit tight. Quality seems quite good at this price so no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Thieman

customer_reviews.title: Poor protection from bees!
customer_reviews.text: Garbage product. Bees stung my arm straight through it. One shortly after got in through the head piece and stung me in the face. Try another product
customer_reviews.author: jeremiah w pyrdol

customer_reviews.title: metal on veil broke through on the second wearing.
customer_reviews.text: I am returning this - it broke on the second wearing, the metal on the veil snapped and popped through the stitching. I got a nice scrape on my arm reaching up to see why my veil was acting strangely. The fabric is very heavy and not breathable at all. There was good visibility, but not worth the cost for a poorly made design.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great suit and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I received my bee suit the other day and tried it right away. It fits very nice and was comfortable.This suit works great for getting suited up quick. I bought 2 for when the grand kids and others want to watch me work with the bees. My bees are very docile so I usually do not need to use a full suit even though I Have one.
customer_reviews.author: jims

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected...
customer_reviews.text: Started to get a more expensive jacket, you get what you pay for and all that, but chose this one after some thought. Works great! with the gloves i picked with it, i was covered comfortably. transported and opened my new hive, and later installed the reducer with no stings, although not for lack of trying on their part. Very concerned with my eyes and this screened hat worked perfectly. All i think I'll ever need with my small 2-hive hobby.
customer_reviews.author: Moira

customer_reviews.title: Tired of Mosquitoes so I bought a Bee Suit!
customer_reviews.text: High quality. I actually purchased this because I do an activity outside where there are a ton of mosquitoes and I was tired of putting smelly repellents and chemicals on my body to detract them. Desperate times call for desperate measures, so I bought this bee suit. This works great.
customer_reviews.author: Interesting AF

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in the L and XL for my husband and I since we are starting out in our first year of beekeeping. It’s lightweight and it gets the job done. I have not had any issues with stings through the jacket either. I haven’t had any issues with the zipper or veil, good starter jacket for us.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: bee careful
customer_reviews.text: The suit works. The zippers work well. However it is made of thin broad cloth (i am guessing). My girls can sting through the material. I would recommend a thick long sleeve under this might help stop that. I will keep mine as a backup, but I am looking for something that will better protect me.
customer_reviews.author: Micha

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to work on a project to close to someone elses hives. Worked 6 hours in it today at 84 degrees and full sun. A little hot but not horrible. Seems durable.
customer_reviews.author: Pat B.

customer_reviews.title: Bee barrier
customer_reviews.text: After my dad got stung by hundreds of bees I surprised him with this set. Great quality and even better protection. He goes out and harvests that honey like bears do. No bees bother him.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: The way it's made the part around your head lays down on your skin too much and bees can sting you right through it. It needs more support to keep its shape while you move around.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good value for the price,, but the size is a medium not at all large. It is fine for a woman, but would be way to small for a man in the med/large as described.
customer_reviews.author: Brooks

customer_reviews.title: hobby bee jacket/veil
customer_reviews.text: It is certainly a good value for the price, however it is much thinner fabric than my official bee jacket/veil from Better bees. I wouldn't do much around a defensive hive with this one, it's more for onlookers and curious guests, but for the money it's a great "extra" to have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: drdrdenise

customer_reviews.title: Bee-lievable Halloween costume
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a kid-friendly Halloween costume at work and people loved it. I sewed bees to the outside to really make it look like a bee-lievable costume
customer_reviews.author: kellz bellz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent suit
customer_reviews.text: I like this bee suit and it's not too hot. There's lots of room to move around and it's pretty durable. Of course this is not one of the complete summer airflow suits so it does get warm in the middle of the summer
customer_reviews.author: Carol R

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but size runs small
customer_reviews.text: These jackets rock. Light weight and breathable. Size runs small I knew that before hand and bought xl for my size large husband he likes his as much as I like mine.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Troche

customer_reviews.title: Very adequate protection
customer_reviews.text: Disliked fabric of tunic, was hot for summer months. Wish the fabric could wick better. I liked the design of the wide-brimmed hat w/ netting because it held the netting AWAY from face to prevent stinging bees. I used the item as added protection for the possibly of stinging bees/nests re entering a hot bldg that had been unoccupied for 2 years....giving bees of all kinds access and opportunity to build nests and maintain active colonies undesturbed.
customer_reviews.author: david gentry

customer_reviews.title: buy better quality item
customer_reviews.text: Not heavy enough fabric....hat must be secured with scarf. Material is thin on crown of hat. I have been stung through fabric gloves and you would definiely be stung through crown of hat. I wore additional heaving shir under the outfit. Will not return this because I have used it, but if you can afford too, buy better quality item.
customer_reviews.author: clroyal220

customer_reviews.title: Not afraid of wasps when trimming shrubs anymore
customer_reviews.text: I did wear this to finish trimming my shrubs after getting stung on the face which is what prompted me to buy this. I did, however get stung on my hand...so wear gloves!
customer_reviews.author: Gale

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: Great product, great price. I got this for my mom for Mother's Day, since she has recently taken a class and set up a hive. She had been using a jerry-rigged heavy shirt, buttoned up to her neck, and a visor that she had whenever she worked with the bees. When she opened this present for Mother's Day, she was thrilled and put it on right there in the house. Two months later, I still get to hear how thrilled she is with this anytime I visit. For the ~$25 that I spent on this (plus the gloves that I bought her), this was a home run.
customer_reviews.author: Fried Rice

customer_reviews.title: A great price for what you get
customer_reviews.text: Protects me well from bees in my hives. Roomy fit for my average frame. The hood protects me well and have not been stung through the mesh. A great price for what you get. I replace mine when needed and have an extra on hand so will be ordering another soon.
customer_reviews.author: sudie

customer_reviews.title: Does what it’s supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: I’m allergic to wasps and have 5 acres to mow. This has saved my butt from plenty of pain. It’s just very, very, itchy and uncomfortable in this mid Atlantic summer climate.
customer_reviews.author: bryan_ldfrd

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality beginner bee coat with attached veil. The body is cloth and not the cheap plastic-y fake material stuff you get at a big box farm supply.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Zimpleman

customer_reviews.title: Good Bee suit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this suit after reading many reviews from other similar bee suits. Key complaint for many suites was the size being too small. I'm 6'1", 185# and this suit in size XL fits perfect. The material is sturdy cotton and its manufactured very well. Happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Holzwurm

customer_reviews.title: Perfect costume
customer_reviews.text: Used as a bee-keeper costume (cannot vouch for bee-safety). Seems to be very high quality material. Fit perfectly and looked really cool. Kept it in case we ever do have a bee emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t recommend it as a primary jacket
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t recommend it as a primary jacket. I ordered it for my daughter, who is my second set of hands when I work the hives. It is perfectly fine as a backup or a spare, but not as versatile or durable as one you’d pay more money for.
customer_reviews.author: Theo50

customer_reviews.title: Just got done picking stingers out of my neck.
customer_reviews.text: Just got done picking 9 stingers out of my neck. Im not even counting my forehead or chin. Save your money and go with something better than this. They sting right through the mesh.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Romeo

customer_reviews.title: fabric is lightweigh
customer_reviews.text: I wear 2x and that is what I order. It is a little tight. Elastic wrist is tighter than I like as is the waist.I will order 3x in the future if it stands up to my abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Michael Dwight

customer_reviews.title: Great price great jacket
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I would change is to have something on the neck so the jacket does not touch your skin. That is the only potental sting spot & issue I have with this. A simple rag or cloth works to solve this though
customer_reviews.author: Dane Enterline

customer_reviews.text: I like this jacket so much better than my previous one. The brim keeps the netting away from your face so you can see what you're doing. Wrist elastic is tight so no one can sneak up the sleeve. Roomy for movement. Just pull over the head & you're ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: sasha t.

customer_reviews.title: Felt good
customer_reviews.text: have not use it yet but it cover well and felt good. I like that the hat open. I must remember to zip all the way to keep bees out.
customer_reviews.author: Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: My father got attacked by bees so we make him wear this whenever he steps foot outside. It is great to see him in it so he doesn't have to go to the hospital again like last time. Thank you VIVO
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K.

customer_reviews.title: Returned it. Veil touches neck.
customer_reviews.text: I returned mine. Was to large. Plus netting was touching the back of neck, and parts of face. Bees could sting with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Accutek

customer_reviews.title: No more stings!
customer_reviews.text: My husband used this to tackle a hornets nest after he was attacked while mowing the grass! It worked perfectly. No more stings!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: This item, while cheap and well reviewed, is not long lasting. I have had this this pull over for around 3 months, and the veil screen ripped, while I was pulling it off, rendering it useless. The screen on the hood is not well constructed, and the built in hat sits on either the front part or back part of your head, allowing bees closer access to either your neck or head. It is less than $25 for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: Danimal

customer_reviews.title: Too thin...bees sting through it
customer_reviews.text: This is hot and the bees can sting through it. Invest more money in a good breathable jacket. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Pattyann

customer_reviews.title: We love and care for bees
customer_reviews.text: We love and care for bees, and occasionally they get cranky. This VIVO integrated hat, veil, and hood is absolutely fantastic. Bees love the white color so just wear it with a brown jump suit and proper gloves and you will be totally protected. Don't wear blue or black around bees. They get really cranky.
customer_reviews.author: Music Is Life

customer_reviews.title: the design is perfect BUT the material is pretty thin so if you ...
customer_reviews.text: the design is perfect BUT the material is pretty thin so if you are working a hot hive id recommend wearing a tyvek suit under it and maybe tape a piece in the hood to protect your head. i keep it as a backup incase something happens to my suit or incase someone else needs to borrow it.
customer_reviews.author: George Heath

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Cleaned out a bald faced hornet nest and didnt get stung so I am happy with the suit. They were all over me as well. Fit properly.
customer_reviews.author: Tera B.

customer_reviews.title: XL Size Extends To My Waist and Has a Snug Fitting Elastic To Keep The Bees Out
customer_reviews.text: Beginning Bee Keeper and this was a very cost effective purchase. Elastic cuffs and waist band. Pleased with this good value item.
customer_reviews.author: R A Wellman

customer_reviews.title: DON'T  BUY  THIS  BEEKEEP  PROTECTION......!
customer_reviews.text: I wore this today to open my 2 hives. While removing a frame -wearing this bee keep top, got stung twice. I have two very obvious stings. Would really like to return this and get a refund to put towards something of better quality. Buyer beware....
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment!👎🏻
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment! 😩thin material that bees can very easily sting thru. I have 2 great jackets w/veils but needed pants. These are ridiculous. My chefs pants are thicker! I’m thru with online junk. Donating the whole outfit. Go to a reputable bee store if you want quality. VIVO should stick to extractors, etc & forget making a quick $45 on such a RIDICULOUS “beekeeping outfit”! 👎🏻
customer_reviews.author: sue

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This bee jacket is cool, comfortable, and easy to wear. The 2 front pockets come in handy for my hive tool and a small notebook. Has held up great with weekly use. Good bargain,
customer_reviews.author: J.L. Nilsson

customer_reviews.title: Good if you have docile bees.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a relatively new beekeeper and my first veil was more expensive. I bought this as a back up but I made me appreciate my first veil even more. With that said. Pros: Thin / light weight material makes it good for hot temperatures. Cons: 1. When you sweat the veil sticks to you, a potential risk for stings. 2. The elastic at your wrist allows bees to get in if one doesn't wear gloves. 3. The head gear doesn't fit around the crown of my head but I guess one could wear a cap underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Youth size fits approx age 6
customer_reviews.text: This will work nicely for my kids to be at a distance from the hives and watch but is not sturdy enough for them to work up close. Cuffs are loose. The youth size fits about size 6, maybe 7. Its not too big for a five year old. Don't think it would stretch to larger than that. As other reviewers have mentioned, I recommend a baseball cap turned backwards underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. R

customer_reviews.title: He loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing jacket for the price. I bought this for my husband who is 6 foot tall and a little over 200 pounds. It fits perfect! He really loves the wide brim "hat" and the convenient "pull over' style. Previously he wore a full suit and wanted something easier.
customer_reviews.author: Nebz

customer_reviews.title: materials are equivalent to price point, but I dont ...
customer_reviews.text: materials are equivalent to price point, but I dont trust the mesh all the way around the neck area. Other options on the market have closed material all the way around and only mesh screen up front. I don't find myself using this product at all, only for family or friends that view work in the beeyard from a distance. I would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Jenson

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 12 year old son. It fits pretty well and the quality isn't bad for the price. I expect it to last at least two seasons but at 1/4 the price of other jackets I find that to be reasonable. This jacket would be great for growing kids, new beekeepers or to keep around as a low cost spare.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: which I ordered for my grandson ( he is 10) I love the material it fits him nicely with room to ...
customer_reviews.text: I received my first bee suit med / large, which I ordered for my grandson ( he is 10) I love the material it fits him nicely with room to grow. The veil could be a little thicker but I am hoping for the best! I did our a second one for my other grandson! Thanks for the great price!
customer_reviews.author: Janice S.

customer_reviews.title: nice but could use exit zipper
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality, just wish it were zippered. had an extremely difficult time getting my 91 year old dad out of it!
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN MARS

product_meta.title: VIVO Professional White Extra Large Beekeeping Suit, Jacket, Pull Over, Smock with Veil (BEE-V105XL)
feature_bullets: SIZING INFORMATION - Measures 45" from the brim of the hat to the elastic waistband, 29" from shoulder to elastic sleeve, and 30" from the hood zipper to the elastic waistband.
LIGHTWEIGHT MATERIAL - The lightweight fabric creates protection against stings while keeping you cool on hot summer days.
PROTECTIVE HOOD - The hood zips partially off so you can put it back when not in use.
FRONT POCKET - The 8" large pocket on the front of the jacket provides extra storage.
CLEANING INSTRUCTIONS - The jacket and hood are hand washable.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,237 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
